oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Washington Family
Wessyngton Plantation, Washington family descendants
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group of African Americans sitting and standing against a log fence. The group includes five middle aged men and women, a number of children dressed in light colored clothes and hats, and, second from left, Emmanuel Washington who was called "Uncle Man."
This group of Washington family descendants includes at least one former slave, Emmanuel Washington, also called Uncle Man, who was the paid cook at Wessyngton Plantation after the Civil War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African Americans; Families
Building a Future Through Opportunity
